description: In this post, Fabio Collini shows how to test this code using Mockito and some RxJava utility classes.

description: César Ferreira shares some command line tips & tricks for Android development.
title: Mastering the Terminal side of Android development

description: Google has brought Android Nougat to its second iteration with the 7.1 version (API 25). This post explores App Shortcuts: how they work, and how you can implement them.
title: Exploring Android Nougat 7.1 App Shortcuts

description: Zarah Dominguez shares what she learned about adding new Nougat features to apps.

description: Roman Danylyk describes how to create a custom view, in this case a ViewPager indicator.
title: Android: draw a custom view

description: Using Firebase Remote Config, we can do much more than just stage rollout an entire app – we can actually stage rollout individual features.
title: How to Stage Rollout Features using Firebase Remote Config

description: One of GDE Wojtek Kaliciński's favorite recent additions to Android Studio is the APK Analyzer, which you can find in the top menu under Build → Analyze APK.
title: Making the most of the APK analyzer

description: When using RxJava, how do you load data that's cached locally but also needs to be refreshed remotely? Here's one way to do it.
title: `Rxify` : The Anti Cache-then-Network OR Network-then-Cache Problem

description: Anup Cowkur believes a common mistake oft repeated is that developers keep including too many lifecycle events inside their presenters, destroying the separation between the view and presentation layers.
title: Your presenters don’t need all those lifecycle events

description: This post covers how to send push notification using Android Firebase.
title: How to send notifications using Android Firebase

description: Scott Meschke shares a new Rx recipe for wrapping existing APIs using fromCallable.
title: RxRecipes: Wrap your way to Rx

description: GDE Enrique López Mañas dives into a topic that it is not widely used or understood: the transient modifier in Java.
title: Diving deeper into the Java transient modifier

description: Join the Kobiton Beta and test your mobile app on the devices you need, when you need them. Automatically generated activity logs help you track your progress and identify issues faster whether you are manually testing or running automated scripts. Sign up now and start testing in minutes.
title: Test your Mobile App on Real Devices for Free

description: You're on the cutting edge of technology, why job hunt like it's '90s? Try Hired today and have 4,000+ top companies apply for the chance to interview you.

title: Lead/Senior Software Engineer

description: Tinker is a hot-fix solution library for Android, it supports dex, library and resources update without reinstalling apk

description: Google has published ConstraintLayout beta 4. This release fixes a few bugs related to guideline positioning and use of include tag, plus some additional performance improvement.

description: Google Play services 10.0.x is the final release that includes full support for Android version 2.3.x (Gingerbread).
title: Google Play services ending support for Gingerbread

description: Google has released Android Studio 2.3 Canary 2 to the Canary and Dev channels. This build contains a large number of bug fixes and a handful of new features.
title: Android Studio 2.3 Canary 2 is now Available

description: Devknox is a first of its kind security tool that enables developers to detect and resolve security issues as they write code in Android Studio. While it checks for basic security issues, developers also get real-time suggestions to fix these issues instantly. Consider it to be like an autocorrect for security issues.
title: Announcing Devknox - Autocorrect for Security Issues

description: Since ClassyShark 7.2 the APK view screen is totally re-written and became the APK Dashboard. This screen shows all the important info about your APK and its components.
title: APK Dashboard in ClassyShark

description: Stickers, GIFs and other rich content are available through soft keyboards in Android 7.1 and also in revision 25.0.0 of the v13 Support Library.

description: Take a deep dive into Dagger's generated code to better understand Dependency Injection and Dagger 2's recent optimizations.
